What Happened: Xi Jinping unveiled a Global Governance Initiative while presiding over a vast military parade attended by Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong Un, showcasing hypersonic missiles and laser-defence systems.

The Background: Ostensibly marking 80 years since WWII's end, the event served to challenge the US-led order. China displayed inter-continental missiles, autonomous underwater drones and other next-gen platforms, framing itself as champion of a "more democratic" world system.

Why This Matters: The initiativeâ€”built on sovereign equality, rule-based multilateralism and development rightsâ€”signals Beijing's most explicit bid to reshape global institutions, courting the Global South while eroding Western dominance.

Knowledge Connect: Ties to multipolarity, hegemonic transition theory and hard-soft power fusion.

Think Deeper: How do rising powers historically alter the balance of institutions? What options remain for mid-sized states navigating competing systems?

Global Perspective: Critics note the paradox of extolling peace alongside allies active in current conflicts, underscoring tensions between rhetoric and reality.

Key Concepts: Deterrence, strategic autonomy, alliance politics, global governance, norm entrepreneurship.
